abstract.p: List of state parks along Connecticut's coast (S)

block.p: HAMMONASSETT STATE PARK is at Exit 62 of Interstate 95. A connector road goes directly into the park from the Interstate exit. Admission: $5 for state residents during the week ($8 for out of staters) and $7 on Saturday, Sunday and holidays ($12 for out of staters). Camp sites are $12 a night, with reservations required (877-668- CAMP).
SILVER SANDS STATE PARK is off Meadowside Road in Milford, though it is most easily accessed by U.S. 1 (follow the signs). Admission: free.

HAMMONASSETT STATE PARK is at Exit 62 of Interstate 95. A connector road goes directly into the park from the Interstate exit. Admission: $5 for state residents during the week ($8 for out of staters) and $7 on Saturday, Sunday and holidays ($12 for out of staters). Camp sites are $12 a night, with reservations required (877-668- CAMP).
SILVER SANDS STATE PARK is off Meadowside Road in Milford, though it is most easily accessed by U.S. 1 (follow the signs). Admission: free.

HARKNESS MEMORIAL STATE PARK is at Exit 81 of Interstate 95 in Waterford. Head south on Cross Road to U.S. 1; turn left (north) on U.S. 1 and follow signs to park entrance, which is officially on Great Neck Road. Admission: $4 for state residents, $5 for out of staters. (860- 443-5725).
OCEAN BEACH PARK is at 1225 Ocean Avenue (Route 213) in New London. Take Exit 84 of Interstate 95 (U.S.1). Admission: $6 during the week; $10 on weekends. $2 for pedestrians. (800-510-SAND).
SEASIDE PARK is at off Park Avenue or Iranistan Avenue in Bridgeport. Take the University of Bridgeport exit of Interstate 95. Admission: $5 for state residents, $10 for out of staters.
